com.continuent.tungsten.fsm.event
Interface EventDispatcher

All Known Implementing Classes:
EventDispatcherTask
public interface EventDispatcher

Denotes a class that can dispatch events to a state machine. It handles normal events, out-of-band events, and event cancellation.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Teemu Ollakka, Robert Hodges

Method Summary
 boolean cancelActive(EventRequest request, boolean mayInterruptIfRunning)
          Cancel a currently running request.
 EventRequest put(Event event)
          Puts an event in the queue for normal processing.
 EventRequest putOutOfBand(Event event)
          Cancel all pending events and put a new event in the queue for immediate processing.
 void setListener(EventCompletionListener listener)
          Set a listenener for event completion.
 

Method Detail

setListener

void setListener(EventCompletionListener listener)
Set a listenener for event completion.

put

EventRequest put(Event event)
                 throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Puts an event in the queue for normal processing. This method returns a Future that callers can call to obtain the event status.

Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException

putOutOfBand

EventRequest putOutOfBand(Event event)
                          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Cancel all pending events and put a new event in the queue for immediate processing.

Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException

cancelActive

boolean cancelActive(EventRequest request,
                     boolean mayInterruptIfRunning)
                     throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Cancel a currently running request.

Parameters:
request - Request to cancel
mayInterruptIfRunning - If true we can cancel running as opposed to enqueued request
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException
